summary: Finally be able to play that wizened old mage that uses a staff to get along!
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ffff00][size=5]What this mod does:[/size][/color]

[size=3][color=#00ff00]This mod adds alternate versions of all staves in the game and allows them to be carried like a torch to give a very convincing illusion in third person that you are, in fact, walking with a staff. These staves can only be added through the console. I have not added any torch or lighting effects to them. I haven't figured out how to do that yet. If there are enough requests for this, i will make a version 2 and update it. Here are the names of the staves so all you have to do is type in help "staff of madness" (or the other names listed below) and then just player.additem xxxxxxxxx to put it in your inventory.[/color] [/size]

[size=5][color=#ffff00]Names:[/color] [/size]

[color=#00ff00][size=3]Staff of Madness = Wabbajack
Staff of the Rose = Sanguine Rose
Staff of the Magus = Staff of Magnus
Staff of Worms = Skull of Corruption
Staff of Mora = Miraak's Staff
Staff of Illusion = Staff of Arcane Authority
Staff of Restoration = Staff of Healing Hands
Staff of Conjuration = Staff of Frost Atronoch
Staff of Destruction = Dragon Priest Staff
Staff of Alteration = Staff of Magelight[/size][/color]

[color=#ff0000][size=5]Warning: Do not have staff in hand when activating your horse or mount to ride. This will result in an instant CTD. I'm not sure what causes this but i'm looking into the issue.[/size]

[/color][size=3][color=#00ff00]This mod has not been tested with female player characters, so there is a chance that it might not fit in the hands exactly.[/color] [/size]


[size=5][color=#ffff00]Requirements:[/color]

[/size][color=#00ff00][size=3]Dragonborn[/size][/color]

[color=#ffff00][size=5]Future Updates:[/size][/color][size=3] [/size]

[color=#00ff00][size=3]- Add light effects to the staves
- Add passive enchantments
- Add more staves like the ones not featured i.e. aetherium staff, hag's wrath, etc.[/size][/color]

[color=#ffff00][size=5]Credits:

[/size][/color][color=#00ff00][size=3]Full credit to maximluppov for giving me instructions on how to do this and creating his awesome Meridia's Light mod http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32842/?[/size][/color]
author: Xgp15a
